name: MX vs. ATV Supercross Encore
description: Rip, jump and scrub your way to victory with over 35 tracks in this vastly extended version! Only the Encore edition features the brand new Rhythm Racing mode, extra outdoor Nationals tracks, and exclusive Waypoint races in open world maps.

reviews.review_text: At first coming from reflex, I hated this game with a passion. But after having over 2k hours on reflex over the years, it was time to look for something else. 1st impression, no feel for the bike, couldn't turn, coudln't whip, could barely make any of the jumps. And why is the camera panning sideways in 3rd person? This of all things really screwed me over, this panning of the camera sideways in every turn, made it very easy to run off the track in every turn. I felt limited it what I could do.   Quit and played reflex some more, but the hours were wearing me down. Started playing Encore again when I heard KTM's were released as DLC. This time I gave it an honest try with an open mind, not allowing the sea of negativity to influence my opinion before I gave the game an real try. I would play to get to a point where I could get some clean laps in and start pushing, because this is where racing games come alive, when you are on the gas!   The biggest difference for me between liking and hating this game, (other than the KTM's), was forgetting about 3rd person and playing in 1st person. After I started getting some basic lines down it really felt like Encore was designed to be played in 1st person, not 3rd. The game just felt so much more fluid in this view, much closer to what I've come to expect from an MX vs ATV game. Looked way better and played better as you feel the bike more as you actually have a feel for the front of the bike. 3rd person by comparison feels very, VERY stiff and static. ALOT of people will probably disagree, but I think this game is better than Reflex. There, I said it.  There are two major things about this game that annoy me.  The first is obvious; the framerate issues. From the poor console port of Reflex from 7 years ago, until now, these games have had poor framerate issues (and graphical issues on Reflex for some cards including mine). Whenever you're by yourself on a supercross track, the framerate is almost always above 60fps on newer hardware. Anywhere else (nationals, free ride, rhythm racing), it drops considerably. The developers have said that this is due to the trees, and the lag everywhere else is due to the dirt physics and terrain deformation. I kinda halfway believe that this is the case, but whatever.  The second is the clutch kick. It is WAY too strong. Yes, it gets you out of terrible situations whenever you don't hit a rhythm perfectly, but in no way should it be that strong, especially on hard packed dirt. Once they tone that down a bit, I'd say this game is pretty spot on with its physics.  Also, the track scaling is pretty big compared to real life like it has been for previous games (except Alive, which was rebranded to this. The smaller tracks in Alive had perfect scaling IMO), but I remember seeing an interview where a developer explained that this is because they want the game to have the pick-up-and-play aspect and that the game isn't too hard. Eh, I can live with that.  If the problems can be fixed in a timely manner, this game gets a solid 8.5/10 from me. If not, it's staying at a 6/10. I can still recommend this game based on its potential and current playability.

The worst performing PC game i have played in years.  Just bought the game and wish i hadn't. Honestly what the hell is going on with this game?. Its hardly a looker in the first place but i'm getting as little as single digits in some of the outside tracks, The indoor tracks run anywhere from 40-80fps. It almost seems like the engine is broken and won't use more than 50% of your gpu and cpu because Afterburner shows that my gpu never goes about 50% and my cpu cores are in the 40-55% range at all times.  My Specs -  Q9650 Quad @ 4.0ghz 8GB Ram Overclocked GTX970  Oh and before someone says 'thats an old cpu, maybe its bottlenecking your gpu', i can get 99% gpu usage on almost every game i play, including maxing out games like Witcher 3 (minus hairworks) at 60fps, Battlefront max at 60fps etc.  In fact i have not played a game, since i got my 970, that i couldn't max or close to max at 60fps. Not this game though lol.  It made me think that maybe my game didn't update because i read about performence updates that had been released, but Steam is set to 'always keep this game up to date', so god knows how the game used to run before these updates!!!.  I'd get an refund if i could but i bought the game off Bundle Stars and i'm not sure if you can refund with them sigh.  Honestly devs, i know its not an easy job but f''k me, this game is a joke.
